main event: A bright red stationary object was sighted over Macomb County, Michigan on January 25, 1955 at 0130 local time.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3 hours by ground-visual and air-visual/electronic means.
An F-86 aircraft was scrambled by the 30th Air Division to investigate the object.
The object was determined to be a bright red marker light on top of a 50-foot radio antenna, creating an unusual optical illusion when viewed through binoculars.
Weather conditions at the time included clear skies and cold temperatures, with winds from the east-southeast.
The report includes details of the investigation by Lt. Cunnion, M/Sgt Pacos, and A/2C Bellfuss of the 4602nd Air Intelligence Service Squadron.
